info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 10:22PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Angelina River Near Lufkin affecting Angelina and Nacogdoches Counties.
For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Angelina River near Lufkin.
* WHEN...From late tonight until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 162.0 feet, Minor lowland to diminish and end on the lower Angelina River.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 160.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 158.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 161.6 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 161.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Friday evening at 1030 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
